Set.User Query: The set of suppliers A, B, and C.

Parameter.User Query: Cost of ordering from Supplier A is $120.
Cost of ordering from Supplier B is $110.
Cost of ordering from Supplier C is $100.
Each order from Supplier A will include 20 tables.
Parameter.description: Number of units per order from supplier A

Parameter.User Query: Each order from Suppliers B and C will include 15 tables.
Parameter.description: Number of units per order from suppliers B and C

Parameter.User Query: The restaurant needs to order at least 150 tables.
Parameter.description: Minimum total number of tables required

Parameter.User Query: The restaurant needs to order no more than 600 tables.
Parameter.description: Maximum total number of tables allowed

Parameter.User Query: If the restaurant decides to order tables from Supplier A, it must also order at least 30 tables from Supplier B.
Parameter.description: Minimum quantity of supplier B if supplier A is chosen

Parameter.User Query: If the restaurant decides to order tables from Supplier A, the sum of tables supplied from Supplier A and B is at least 25.
Parameter.description: Minimum sum of supplier A and B if supplier A is chosen

Parameter.User Query: If the restaurant decides to order tables from Supplier B, the sum of tables supplied from Supplier B and C is at least 30.
Parameter.description: Minimum sum of supplier B and C if supplier B is chosen

Parameter.User Query: The restaurant must order tables at least 7 times from Supplier A or B or C.
The total tables supplied from Supplier A can not exceed 60.
Parameter.description: Maximum units from supplier A allowed
Big-M value used in indicator constraints.

Decision Variables.User Query: Number of orders from Supplier A.
Number of orders from Supplier B.
Number of orders from Supplier C.
Indicator variable for ordering from Supplier A.
Indicator variable for ordering from Supplier B.
Indicator variable for ordering from Supplier C.

Objective function.Latex Model: \min \quad c_{A} \cdot x_{A} + c_{B} \cdot x_{B} + c_{C} \cdot x_{C}

Constraints.User Query: The restaurant needs to order no more than 600 tables.
If the restaurant decides to order tables from Supplier A, it must also order at least 30 tables from Supplier B.
If the restaurant decides to order tables from Supplier A, it must also order at least 30 tables from Supplier B.
If the restaurant decides to order tables from Supplier A, it must also order at least 30 tables from Supplier B.
If the restaurant decides to order tables from Supplier B, it must also order tables from Supplier C.
If the restaurant decides to order tables from Supplier B, it must also order tables from Supplier C.
